org.amv.access.sdk.spi.bluetooth

Interface BluetoothCommunicationManager

  • All Superinterfaces:
    CommunicationManager

    public interface BluetoothCommunicationManager
extends CommunicationManager
    An interface extending CommunicationManager with methods for handling bluetooth communications.

    In addition to the methods provided by CommunicationManager there are mechanisms to hook into the bluetooth connection handling. This way one can react to certain events, e.g. broadcasting failed, device communication channel has been closed, incoming errors, etc.

    This is useful if you want to inform the user about the current state of the bluetooth communication.

    • Method Summary

      <any> observeIncomingCommands()

    • Method Detail

      • observeBroadcastState

        <any> observeBroadcastState()
        Observe every change in the broadcast state.
        Returns:
        an observable emitting broadcast state changes

      • observeConnectionState

        <any> observeConnectionState()
        Observe every change in the connection state.
        Returns:
        an observable emitting connection state changes

      • observeIncomingCommands

        <any> observeIncomingCommands()
        Observe every incoming command from an established connection.

        This method is useful when extending the sdk to emit more fine grained events, e.g. transforming the command into a vehicle state update.

        Returns:
        an observable emitting commands coming from the connected device

      • observeIncomingFailureMessages

        <any> observeIncomingFailureMessages()
        Observe every incoming failure message.

        This method represents a way to communicate failures. The returned object is wrapped in an AccessSdkException.

        Returns:
        an observable emitting error messages coming from the connected device
